The UI is a bit amateur, but the functionality is solid, and V2 has improved quite a number of aspects of the software.  I highly recommend this software and downloading Kenny's Crosshair pack, it works great with HudSight.

Not all games allow overlays (Counter Strike 2, The Finals), but plenty of games do allow it, and it's "usually" whitelisted by EAC games (Apex Legends, Halo MCC, Halo: Infinite)

The one oddity I ran into was that The Finals open beta wouldn't let me start the game with the software running and said an unsupported software was running, so keep that in mind if you ever see a game refuse to start.

First: I bought the product and installed it. It didn't inject properly in Rust, which is the only reason I got it in the first place. I rebooted my machine and tried again with no success.

Second: asked for a refund. Tried the hudsight 2 version, which is not on steam and you get from hudsight.com
This trial version made my game drop from 160 to 40 in the menu, and eventually crash (but it did render the sight)

Third: i unistall all of this software and never will try again, not worth my time.

Extra: if there was another version of this software, it should be on steam too. That makes it all more suspicious. Also, if the first version isn't working properly, so that you had to make a second version, you shouldn't charge anyone for a product that doesn't work.

I'd give it a 4.5/5, though mostly because there isn't other sights out there that allow third party overlay while still able to have its own editing software.

A really good and lightweight crosshair app. But I have 2 requests on some QoL changes.

1. Give an option for sprint fade, basically like in titanfall 2, it makes the crosshair become transparent when running, could be binded to any key, but that'd be it's main purpose, to increase visibility withou fully removing the crosshair.

2. Give an option to change crosshair at a press of a key, mainly based of titanfall 2, where not all weapons have their own sights, where changing a crosshair to something like a dot when pressing RmB could be more practical.

But other than that, the app is really good and recommand to everyone else!

Very useful software for a majority of fps games, for shooting or not.

I was able to recreate the anti motion sickness ring used in the viscera clean up detail.
Fireworks is the software I used, I create a transparent background and draw a doughnut shape, then center it.
Many games that does not have 4k monitor UI support, end up having tiny UI/cursor elements will benefit from this too.

One bug I encountered is the editor does not support editing large cursors like the one with 512x512 size. By editing the cursor, the editor instantly break the program and I have to restart it to use it.
Another concern is, I read about some issue that people got banned from online PvP games for using custom cursor, many stated that screenshots was used for cheat detection.

It's - pretty good to OK.
Some complain of input lag, I haven't had that issue.

You may need to run your game in borderless-windowed. It runs in a Playclaw Overlay, which basically means its whitelisted by all anticheats except VAC (won't work with CSGO)

It has a crosshair lean function, which is... OK, but not really that great. It does have a toggle current crosshair on/off function as well, which is useful. It can even be on hold to hide, which is great for scoping in, etc.

There is an editor that allows you to create any crosshair you could imagine. Or, you can upload a premade image. This is a fairly nice feature.

You can move the offest of the crosshair, which is ideal for games such as Hunt, with an offest screen view.

[strike]One thing that is missing is having a hotkey that could change the crosshair for me - 
Both the ability to press one that cycles my crosshair, and one that is a direct bind to the crosshair, so that it would switch between my hitscan pistol and my ballistic calculator for my sniper rifle when I select said weapons...[/strike]

[B][I]I take it back. IF YOU right click a crosshair IN HUD Sight, you can bind it to a hotkey. WOW> 5 STAR RATED APP

By far, this is significantly better than the other crosshair apps I've ever used.

I talked to Fortnite/Epic about this addon and received this corporate non-response:

"To protect our anticheat methodologies, we cannot confirm whether using any particular third party software may result in bans, kicks, or other actions taken against your account. Any use of third party software is entirely at your own risk."

Personally, I see no difference between this app and the overlay provided by a gaming monitor or a red dry-erase marker and don't understand why it would be considered to be a ban/kick offense by Epic.  But, there you go.  Epic reserves the right to arbitrarily ban anyone for any reason.

I use this to help prevent motion sickness in games that don't have crosshairs and it works great. The program itself is kind of jank, but once you've got a crosshair set up its as simple as just running it and hitting the hotkey, which is all you really need.

Devs if you read this I have some improvement suggestions:

1: See about making a steam workshop for user submitted crosshairs
2: Add a transparency slider so even if the crosshair is solid colour we can see through it
3: fix the pixel limit issues with large crosshairs
4: Add a few more editing tools, like drag and drop with a coordinate indicator, when resizing crosshairs in the editor you have to manually remove and place every pixel which gets tedious
5: Ability to make odd pixel count images like 61x61 so the exact center can be a single pixel or 3x3 instead of 2x2, would make things easier than readjusting the offset, some games have oddly offset shooting centerpoints that appear to be centered around a single pixel rather than a 2x2 block of pixels
6: Crashing  GPU issues, so bug fixes would be nice

and 1 more point for crosshair editor

Works as intended.

Editor allows for a great degree of customizability, but could use a few more quality of life changes like color picker (if you are tweaking back and forth a crosshair with more than 1 colour e.g. for outlines), symmetry creation tools, etc. Some people might have also enjoyed a rainbow breathing option, though I think the editor is enough if you know your game's colour palette and you use at least 1-2 colours to make your crosshair pop.

Has a blacklist if you like to leave the program open but you use other programs that do not need it.

The only minor bug that I have encountered is that when you are saving a new crosshair from the editor, moving the text field window results in adding points to the crosshair graph. So really the only thing you have to do is not move the text box window at all.

Would like to see an option to assign more crosshairs to keybinds in order to change on-the fly depending on the weapon or the character you play as. Perhaps even a size switcher too. I was using a script with such functionality in tf2, so I am sure the devs could do that here too.

Good for any first-person game that you devote a lot of time on and that leaves something missing in the crosshair customizability territory. 

The price is ok for the ease of use it provides. I'd recommend it even more heartily if at least some the additions I mentioned were incorporated.

For anyone looking for a custom crosshair app, this one is a really good option.  The recent update has allowed for the creation of RGB colour crosshairs (the previous version was grayscale only), so if like me, you prefer having a two tone crosshair (white cross with black border etc), that option is now available.

The latest update also allows you to hold a key to enable/disable the crosshair, so you could bind it to RMB and have the crosshair vanish when you want to aim down the sights etc.  

Been using this recently to play Doom Eternal, and I haven't suffered any crashes or frame rate stuttering/lag, so it is working as intended.  Just remember that you need the program open in order to use it, and it should work fine.

Definitely recommended if you are looking for a crosshair app that wont cause lag or frame rate stuttering as most overlay crosshairs do.

Does what it says, no fuss and has a lot of reticle customization without the need for image editing still (per pixel editor included).  I use it particularly to play ARK with a reticle on a server cluster that has the game's built-in reticle function disabled server side.

Is pretty good, nicely centered @ 1080p. Able to get custom crosshairs from kovaak's website. Just create, download then throw in your document folders and load it. If you want to increase the size reload the crosshair on the website and increase there, the in app up-scaling seems pretty blurry.

Didn't think it could get any better after using my Eskimo goggles, but HudSight makes me an aiming god!

A recommendation for the developer: Add an option for 'hold hotkey to hide overlay' instead of toggle, that way people can hide their crosshair with RMB when aiming down sights. Also a quick access in the menu to quickly switch between favourited crosshair would be excellent.

Other than that, it's a solid program. Very low resource usage with minimise to system tray whilst active. Instant launch time, no crashes, also allows the option to import custom crosshairs. Does everything it should without extra fuss or clutter. Works outside of Steam games as well. Definitely recommend this.
Good to have to play game with any crosshair color if you're colorblind.

I bought HudSight to use it in DOOM Eternal.
DOOM Eternal has 2 crosshair options:
1. A visually well-made default crosshair which changes with your weapons and gives you additional information. The only problem - it doesn't display a dot in the center for precision shooting.
2. A dot. Nothing else, no additional information, no dot customization.

Now, I want to have a small "dot" in the center - that's how I aim and make micro-adjustments. But I also want the nice crosshairs the game offers me.

In comes HudSight to the rescue!
With it, I modified their "cross + dot" sight into a simple dot sight, scaled it down to 50% so that it's just barely noticeable and went to town on the demons.

I could not believe how better the game felt and how much more confident I was in my aim. Mind you, I aimed perfectly well without the dot, but it just adds a layer of confidence to my shots that I was missing before.

I'm a developer myself and, while I COULD make something like this on my own, the "cup of coffee" price I paid for it makes it more than worth my money and the time-save it provided me.

Thank you Mr. Kozadaev - this is a remarkably simple yet effective tool!

I'm and older gamer and my vision is not what it use to be from back when I started gaming 28 years ago. I play COD Warzone and have been noticing that my gameplay is off and it's hard for me to keep up against better players. I noticed my #1 issue was not being able to see my crosshair easily when not aiming down sights. When I flick on someone I was over shooting or undershooting mouse movement to the target. I play on a top end system with maxed out graphics so there is a lot of screen bling and seeing tiny little white cross hairs on a similar light background was very difficult. What I found out is in some backgrounds during gameplay I just can't see my crosshairs. I downloaded this product, made a neon green circle I can place around my crosshairs to assist me in knowing where they are. My gameplay has improved by 100%. Now I can flick on target and not spend time trying to figure out where my crosshairs are before ADS. Place the giant circle on the target, start spraying rounds as I transition to ADS and use sight/iron sights to kill person. This isn't just for older players but for anyone having issues seeing in games. No clue why COD Warzone doesn't have an option to change color of crosshairs but this program has saved my sanity.
